alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 6:58AM CDT until August 05 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Carroll County in Tennessee... Henry County in Tennessee... Eastern Weakley County in Tennessee... * Until 1000 AM CDT. * At 658 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Paris, McKenzie, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Sharon, Cottage Grove, Routon, Palmersville, Puryear, Henry, Como, Osage, Ore Springs, Whitlock, Porter Court, Jones Mill, Foundry Hill, Mill Creek and Van Dyke. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
